DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's self-reported record of the time when their bowel movement occurred, using hour and minutes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bowel Function Diary for Assessing Opioid-Induced Constipation Defecation Timepoint
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to capture relevant patient information regarding opioid-induced constipation in a clinical trial setting. Three modules record information on bowel movements, symptoms experienced, and treatments used to relieve constipation._The normal process of elimination of fecal material from the rectum._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ISO 8061 time recorded as hh:mm:ss based on a 24 hour clock.   Precision can be truncated by omitting the seconds or both the seconds and minutes (23:59 or 23).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network

ReferenceDocuments.name: Please record the time when t
ReferenceDocuments.description: Please record the time when this bowel movement occurred.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Bowel Function Diary for Assessing Opioid-Induced Constipation (BF-Diary)
Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
